job_title: Nursing Supervisor in New Haven, CT
pros: Great place to work at Elim park
cons: Shortage of people could be a challenge

review_title: So glad I'm out of there. "Nothing ruins a good employee quicker than bad management!" (Meme author unknown)
pros: - Lots of walking = weight loss. - Very talented chefs = great food. - Social functions and parties for residents. - The residents themselves! - Very clean work environment. - Paid 1/2hr break. - Freedom and flexibility on task completion for the most part.
cons: - Lots and lots of favoritism within the dept. - Lots of work, very little pay. - They force you to do tasks you didn't sign up for, and pick up slack where others should be working and are not. - HR; stay away. Lots of lying, fake/false stories and write ups, wrongful termination, and deception. - They force the whole "team work" bs down your throat but when I always asked for help, I never got it and I worked the whole entire building by myself. - So much talented staff left so frequently, like a revolving door. That in itself should say how this place is. - Management was just never happy with how above and beyond I really went and how loyal I was and how my work ethic was displayed. I wore 6 hats in that place (more than everyone on staff) and worked on both sides of the campus by myself for cheap and that's not what I was hired for. Not worth it.......

pros: Beautiful very large building overall. It's pretty well maintained on most floors. Most of the staff is very supportive. There are a lot of available amenities like a pool, workout room, restaurants and a store with employee discounts, and vending machines.
cons: There are a lot of call outs. This is a problem at most nursing facilities but they have a problem filling holes. You're constantly working short. Management barely shows their appreciation for the" lower" staff members. A lot of things seemed to diminish or change after the pandemic hit. Which is understandable, but once the world started getting better again, Elim didn't really pick back up. While they care very much about the appearance, especially on the Independent and Rehab parts of the building, once you go deeper into the building you start to notice the lack of attention. They used to offer all kinds insentives to employees to help with morale but no longer do. As a result you see a lot poorer work ethic. Management has such poor communication skills that no one knows what anyone else is doing and will often push work onto other employees when they don't know what to do.

pros: The staff was great to work with and the president of the Elim park was very involved.

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Middletown, CT
pros: Residents are delightful, work culture is supportive. New president seems invested in improving things for employees.
cons: Management is supportive but out of touch with the daily goings on. Communication isn’t great.

review_title: Great job for highschool/ college students
cons: Mainly work evenings, sometimes get over booked on schedule

pros: flexibility with work schedule was very useful
cons: I do not have any cons
